original_content:
11?02/2010~~~food for thought~~~OBEDIENCE OR INDEPENDENCE?

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"If you love me, keep My commandments" (Jn. 14:15).

Our Lesson for Today:
The Lord does not give me rules, but He makes His standard very clear.
If my relationship with Him is that of love, I will do what He says without
hesitation. If I hesitate, it is because I love someone I have placed in
competition with Him, namely, myself.

Jesus Christ will not force me to obey Him but I must. And as soon as 
I obey Him, I fulfill my spiritual destiny. My personal life may be crowded 
with small, petty happenings, altogether insignificant. 

But if I obey Jesus Christ in the seemingly random circumstances of life, 
they become pinholes through which I see the face of God. Then, when I
stand face to face with God, I will discover that through my obedience
thousands were blessed.

When God's redemption brings a human soul to the point of obedience,
it always produces. ~ If I obey Jesus Christ, the redemption of God will flow 
through me to the lives of others, because behind the deed of obedience 
is the reality of Almighty God.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, forgive me for not living up to Your
standards as I should.Amen. 
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: The Lord does not give me rules, but He makes His standard very clear. If my relationship with Him is that of love, I will do what He says without hesitation. If I hesitate, it is because I love someone I have placed in competition with Him, namely, myself. Jesus Christ will not force me to obey Him but I must. And as soon as I obey Him, I fulfill my spiritual destiny. My personal life may be crowded with small, petty happenings, altogether insignificant. But if I obey Jesus Christ in the seemingly random circumstances of life, they become pinholes through which I see the face of God. Then, when I stand face to face with God, I will discover that through my obedience thousands were blessed. When God's redemption brings a human soul to the point of obedience, it always produces. ~ If I obey Jesus Christ, the redemption of God will flow through me to the lives of others, because behind the deed of obedience is the reality of Almighty God.
original_verse_text: "If you love me, keep My commandments"
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that our love for You should be the driving force behind our obedience. Help us to see that Your commands are not burdensome, but a reflection of Your perfect will for our lives. May we willingly surrender ourselves as living sacrifices, holy and pleasing to You, that through our obedience, the redemption of Christ may flow to those around us. Grant us the courage to follow where You lead, knowing that in doing so, we will fulfill the purpose You have for us. Amen.
reflection: The Lord does not give me rules, but He makes His standard very clear. If my relationship with Him is that of love, I will do what He says without hesitation. If I hesitate, it is because I love someone I have placed in competition with Him, namely, myself. Jesus Christ will not force me to obey Him but I must. And as soon as I obey Him, I fulfill my spiritual destiny. My personal life may be crowded with small, petty happenings, altogether insignificant. But if I obey Jesus Christ in the seemingly random circumstances of life, they become pinholes through which I see the face of God. Then, when I stand face to face with God, I will discover that through my obedience thousands were blessed. When God's redemption brings a human soul to the point of obedience, it always produces. ~ If I obey Jesus Christ, the redemption of God will flow through me to the lives of others, because behind the deed of obedience is the reality of Almighty God.
subject: Obedience Fulfills Spiritual Destiny
verse_text: "If you love me, keep My commandments"

original_content:
11/03/2010~~~food for thought~~~A BONDSERVANT OF JESUS

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"I have been crucified with Christ; it is no longer I who live,
but Christ lives in me." (Gal. 2:20)

Our Lesson for Today:
These words mean the breaking and collapse of our own independence
brought about by our own hands, as well as the surrender of our life to the
supremacy of our Lord Jesus Christ.

No one can do this for us, we must do it for ourselves. God may bring us 
up to this point 365 times a year, but He cannot (will not) push us through it.

It means breaking the hard outer layer of our individual independence from 
God, and the liberating of ourselves and our nature into oneness with Him; not 
following our own ideas, but choosing absolute loyalty to Jesus.

The passion of Christianity comes from deliberately signing away our own rights
and becoming a bondservant to Christ.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, soften my heart so that I would
become obedient to You. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: These words mean the breaking and collapse of our own independence brought about by our own hands, as well as the surrender of our life to the supremacy of our Lord Jesus Christ. No one can do this for us, we must do it for ourselves. God may bring us up to this point 365 times a year, but He cannot (will not) push us through it. It means breaking the hard outer layer of our individual independence from God, and the liberating of ourselves and our nature into oneness with Him; not following our own ideas, but choosing absolute loyalty to Jesus. The passion of Christianity comes from deliberately signing away our own rights and becoming a bondservant to Christ.
original_verse_text: "I have been crucified with Christ; it is no longer I who live, but Christ lives in me."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the need to surrender our lives fully to Your supremacy. Help us to break the hard outer layer of our independence and be liberated into oneness with You. May we no longer follow our own ideas, but choose absolute loyalty to our Lord Jesus Christ. Grant us the passion of Christianity, as we willingly sign away our rights and become Your bondservants. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: These words mean the breaking and collapse of our own independence brought about by our own hands, as well as the surrender of our life to the supremacy of our Lord Jesus Christ. No one can do this for us, we must do it for ourselves. God may bring us up to this point 365 times a year, but He cannot (will not) push us through it. It means breaking the hard outer layer of our individual independence from God, and the liberating of ourselves and our nature into oneness with Him; not following our own ideas, but choosing absolute loyalty to Jesus. The passion of Christianity comes from deliberately signing away our own rights and becoming a bondservant to Christ.
subject: Surrendering to Christ's Supremacy
verse_text: "I have been crucified with Christ; it is no longer I who live, but Christ lives in me."

original_content:
11/04/2010~~~food for thought~~~CALLED TO BE ONE WITH HIM

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Draw near to God and He will Draw near to you." (Jm. 4:8)

Our Lesson for Today: 
When a truth of God is brought home to your soul, never allow it to pass
without acting on it internally in your will, not necessarily in your physical 
life, BUT work it into your life.

The weakest saint who transacts business with Jesus Christ is liberated 
the second he acts and God's almighty power is available on his behalf. 
We come up to the truth of God, confess we are wrong, but turn back
again. ~ Then we approach it again and turn back, until we finally learn 
we have no business going back. ~

When we are confronted with such a word of truth from our redeeming 
Lord, we must move directly to transact business with Him. ~ ~ ~
"Come to Me ." (Mt. 11:28).

His word [come] means "to act." Yet the last thing we want to do is come. 
But everyone who does come knows that, at that very moment, the supernatural power of life of God invades him. The dominating power of the world,
the flesh, and the devil is now paralyzed; not by our act, but because our act
has joined us to God and tapped us in to His redemptive power.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, When I hear the word "Come" help me
to draw near in total obedience. Amen. 

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: When a truth of God is brought home to your soul, never allow it to pass without acting on it internally in your will, not necessarily in your physical life, BUT work it into your life. The weakest saint who transacts business with Jesus Christ is liberated the second he acts and God's almighty power is available on his behalf. We come up to the truth of God, confess we are wrong, but turn back again. ~ Then we approach it again and turn back, until we finally learn we have no business going back. ~ When we are confronted with such a word of truth from our redeeming Lord, we must move directly to transact business with Him. ~ ~ ~ "Come to Me." (Matthew 11:28). His word [come] means "to act." Yet the last thing we want to do is come. But everyone who does come knows that, at that very moment, the supernatural power of life of God invades him. The dominating power of the world, the flesh, and the devil is now paralyzed; not by our act, but because our act has joined us to God and tapped us in to His redemptive power.
original_verse_text: "Draw near to God and He will Draw near to you. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You, weary and heavy-laden, seeking Your rest and redemption. We confess our weakness and our tendency to turn back from the truth You reveal to us. Lord, help us to act on Your word, to move directly to transact business with You, that we may be liberated by Your almighty power. May we never again go back, but instead cling to You, the source of our salvation. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: When a truth of God is brought home to your soul, never allow it to pass without acting on it internally in your will, not necessarily in your physical life, BUT work it into your life. The weakest saint who transacts business with Jesus Christ is liberated the second he acts and God's almighty power is available on his behalf. We come up to the truth of God, confess we are wrong, but turn back again. ~ Then we approach it again and turn back, until we finally learn we have no business going back. ~ When we are confronted with such a word of truth from our redeeming Lord, we must move directly to transact business with Him. ~ ~ ~ "Come to Me." (Matthew 11:28). His word [come] means "to act." Yet the last thing we want to do is come. But everyone who does come knows that, at that very moment, the supernatural power of life of God invades him. The dominating power of the world, the flesh, and the devil is now paralyzed; not by our act, but because our act has joined us to God and tapped us in to His redemptive power.
subject: The Transforming Power of Truth
verse_text: "Draw near to God and He will Draw near to you. "

original_content:
11/05/2010~~~food for thought~~~BEING RECEPTIVE PARTICIPANTS

Our Bible Verse for Today:
". But rejoice that you participate in the suffering of Christ." (I Pet. 4:13)

Our Lesson for Today:
Are we participants of Christ's sufferings?
Are we prepared to stamp out our personal ambitions?
Are we prepared for God to destroy our individual decisions
by supernaturally transforming them?

It will mean not knowing why God is taking us that way, because
knowing would make us spiritually proud. ~ We never realize at 
the time what God is putting us through, we go through it more or 
less without understanding. ~

Then suddenly we come to a place of enlightenment, and realize
"God has strengthened me and I didn't even know it!"

It is only through our relationship with Jesus Christ that we can understand
what God is after in His dealings with us.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, again I pray that I would be more sensitive to your will,
even though I might not understand all your dealings with me. Amen
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: Are we participants of Christ's sufferings? Are we prepared to stamp out our personal ambitions? Are we prepared for God to destroy our individual decisions by supernaturally transforming them? It will mean not knowing why God is taking us that way, because knowing would make us spiritually proud. ~ We never realize at the time what God is putting us through, we go through it more or less without understanding. ~ Then suddenly we come to a place of enlightenment, and realize "God has strengthened me and I didn't even know it!" It is only through our relationship with Jesus Christ that we can understand what God is after in His dealings with us.
original_verse_text: But rejoice that you participate in the suffering of Christ.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that as Your children, we may be called to share in the sufferings of Christ. Help us to be willing to surrender our personal ambitions, trusting that You will supernaturally transform our lives according to Your perfect will. Even when we do not understand the reasons behind Your ways, grant us the grace to endure, knowing that You are strengthening us and working all things for our good. May our relationship with Your Son, Jesus, guide us in this journey of faith. Amen.
reflection: Are we participants of Christ's sufferings? Are we prepared to stamp out our personal ambitions? Are we prepared for God to destroy our individual decisions by supernaturally transforming them? It will mean not knowing why God is taking us that way, because knowing would make us spiritually proud. ~ We never realize at the time what God is putting us through, we go through it more or less without understanding. ~ Then suddenly we come to a place of enlightenment, and realize "God has strengthened me and I didn't even know it!" It is only through our relationship with Jesus Christ that we can understand what God is after in His dealings with us.
subject: Participants in Christ's Sufferings
verse_text: But rejoice that you participate in the suffering of Christ.

original_content:
11/26/2010~~~food for thought~~~DO YOU BELIEVE?

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Who ever lives and believes in Me will never die.
Do you believe this?" (Jn. 11:26)

Our Lesson for Today:
Jesus has power over life and death as well as power to forgive sins.
This is because He is the creator of life (Jn. 14:6). He who is life can 
surely restore life.

whoever believes in Christ has a spiritual life that death cannot conquer 
or diminish in any way. When we realize His power and how wonderful His 
offer to us really is, how can we not commit our lives to Him?

To those of us who believe, what wonderful assurance and certainty we 
have: I will live again, and you will too" (Jn 14:19).

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, thank You, for the most wonderful gift ever given
to all who believe in the Risen Savior, I do believe so I thank 
You. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: Jesus has power over life and death as well as power to forgive sins. This is because He is the creator of life (John 14:6). He who is life can surely restore life. whoever believes in Christ has a spiritual life that death cannot conquer or diminish in any way. When we realize His power and how wonderful His offer to us really is, how can we not commit our lives to Him? To those of us who believe, what wonderful assurance and certainty we have: I will live again, and you will too" (John 14:19).
original_verse_text: "Who ever lives and believes in Me will never die. Do you believe this?"
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the power and authority of Your Son, Jesus Christ, who has power over life and death. We are in awe of His promise that whoever believes in Him will live, even though they die (John 11:26). Help us to fully trust in Your Son, the giver of life, and to find our hope and certainty in Him. May we commit our lives to You, Lord, and live in the assurance that we will live again, just as Jesus promised (John 14:19). Amen.
reflection: Jesus has power over life and death as well as power to forgive sins. This is because He is the creator of life (John 14:6). He who is life can surely restore life. Whoever believes in Christ has a spiritual life that death cannot conquer or diminish in any way. When we realize His power and how wonderful His offer to us really is, how can we not commit our lives to Him? To those of us who believe, what wonderful assurance and certainty we have: "I will live again, and you will too" (John 14:19).
subject: Eternal Life in Christ
verse_text: "Who ever lives and believes in Me will never die. Do you believe this?"

original_content:
11/07/2010~~~food for thought~~~LIVING IN THE MOMENT

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"We know that all things work together for the good 
of those who love God." (Ro. 8:28)

A Lesson to be learned:
With the day following the loss of my mother I sit before my computer wondering:

Am I making the Holy Spirit's work difficult by being vague and unsure, or by trying
to do His work for Him?

I must do the human side of intercession ~ utilizing the circumstances in which I
find myself and the friends and family that surround me. I must keep my conscious
life a sacred place for the Holy Spirit. Then as I lift different ones to God through
prayer, the Holy Spirit intercedes for them.

Your intercession can never be mine ~ and my intercession can never be yours, 
".but the Spirit Himself makes intercession" in each of our lives (Ro. 8:26).

Without that intercession, the lives of others would be left in poverty and in ruin. 
Let us live in the moment, for today has enough trouble of it's own.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, there are many hurting in the world today,
help me to set aside my own concerns, that I may lift 
up others who have even greater problem. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: With the day following the loss of my mother I sit before my computer wondering: Am I making the Holy Spirit's work difficult by being vague and unsure, or by trying to do His work for Him? I must do the human side of intercession ~ utilizing the circumstances in which I find myself and the friends and family that surround me. I must keep my conscious life a sacred place for the Holy Spirit. Then as I lift different ones to God through prayer, the Holy Spirit intercedes for them. Your intercession can never be mine ~ and my intercession can never be yours". but the Spirit Himself makes intercession" in each of our lives (Romans 8:26). Without that intercession, the lives of others would be left in poverty and in ruin. Let us live in the moment, for today has enough trouble of it's own.
original_verse_text: "We know that all things work together for the good of those who love God."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that in all things, You work for the good of those who love You (Romans 8:28). In the midst of our trials and sorrows, we trust that Your Spirit intercedes for us, guiding us and sustaining us (Romans 8:26). Help us to live in the present, embracing each moment with thanksgiving, as You have instructed us (1 Thessalonians 5:16-18). May we be faithful in our prayers, knowing that our intercession is empowered by Your Spirit. Amen.
reflection: With the day following the loss of my mother I sit before my computer wondering: Am I making the Holy Spirit's work difficult by being vague and unsure, or by trying to do His work for Him? I must do the human side of intercession ~ utilizing the circumstances in which I find myself and the friends and family that surround me. Your intercession can never be mine ~ and my intercession can never be yours". but the Spirit Himself makes intercession" in each of our lives (Romans 8:26). Without that intercession, the lives of others would be left in poverty and in ruin. Let us live in the moment, for today has enough trouble of it's own.
subject: Intercession: the Spirit's Work
verse_text: "We know that all things work together for the good of those who love God."

original_content:
11/08/2010~~~FOOD FOR THOUGHT~~~

Our Bible Verse for Today:
We do not know what we ought to pray for, but the spirit Himself intercedes
for us with groaning that words cannot express.(Ro. 8:26)

Our Lesson for Today:
As a believer we need to learn that we are not left to our own resources
to cope with the problems of life. (Thank God!) Even when we do not know 
the right words to pray, the Holy Spirit prays with and for us, and God answers. 

With God's Spirit helping us pray, we need not be afraid to come before Him.
Merely ask the Holy Spirit to intercede for you "in harmony with God's own will."
Then when you bring your requests before God trust that He will always 
do what is best.

Suggested Prayer:
Dear Lord, help me to listen to Your Spirit's voice as I
come to You in prayer. Help me to be willing to trust that
You always know what is best. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: As a believer we need to learn that we are not left to our own resources to cope with the problems of life. (Thank God!) Even when we do not know the right words to pray, the Holy Spirit prays with and for us, and God answers. With God's Spirit helping us pray, we need not be afraid to come before Him. Merely ask the Holy Spirit to intercede for you in harmony with God's own will. Then when you bring your requests before God trust that He will always do what is best.
original_verse_text: We do not know what we ought to pray for, but the spirit Himself intercedes for us with groaning that words cannot express.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that we are not left to face the challenges of life alone. When we struggle to find the right words to pray, we are grateful that Your Holy Spirit intercedes for us, aligning our petitions with Your perfect will. Lord, help us to trust in Your wisdom and timing, knowing that You will always do what is best for us. May we come before You with confidence, resting in the knowledge that Your Spirit is working on our behalf. Amen.
reflection: As a believer, we need to learn that we are not left to our own resources to cope with the problems of life. (Thank God!) Even when we do not know the right words to pray, the Holy Spirit prays with and for us, and God answers. With God's Spirit helping us pray, we need not be afraid to come before Him. Merely ask the Holy Spirit to intercede for you in harmony with God's own will. Then, when you bring your requests before God, trust that He will always do what is best.
subject: Rely on the Holy Spirit
verse_text: We do not know what we ought to pray for, but the spirit Himself intercedes for us with groaning that words cannot express.

original_content:
11/09/2010~~~food for thought~~~SACRED SERVICE

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Now I rejoice in what was suffered for you, and I fill up in my 
flesh what is still lacking in regard to Christ's afflictions, for the 
sake of His body, which is the church. (Col 1:24) (reread this verse)

Our Lesson for Today:
A Christian worker has to be a sacred "go-between." He/she must be so closely 
identified with his Lord and the reality of His redemption that Christ can continually 
bring His creating life through Him.

Now I'm not referring to the strength of one individual's personality being superimposed 
on another, but the real presence of Christ coming through every aspect of the worker's
life. When we preach the historical facts of the life and death of our Lord as they are
conveyed in the New T., our words are made sacred.

God uses these words, on the basis of His redemption, to create something in those
who listen which other wise could never have been created. If we simply preach the
effects of redemption in the human life instead of the revealed, divine truth regarding
Jesus Himself, the result is not new birth in those who listen.

The result is a refined religious life style, and the Spirit of God cannot witness to it 
because such preaching is in a realm other than His. We must make sure that we 
are living in such harmony with God that as we proclaim His truth He can create in
others those things which He alone can do.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I pray that with Your guidance my witness
would always be in harmony with Your will.Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can come to the Father except through me."
John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: A Christian worker has to be a sacred "go-between." He/she must be so closely identified with his Lord and the reality of His redemption that Christ can continually bring His creating life through Him. Now I'm not referring to the strength of one individual's personality being superimposed on another, but the real presence of Christ coming through every aspect of the worker's life. When we preach the historical facts of the life and death of our Lord as they are conveyed in the New T. , our words are made sacred. God uses these words, on the basis of His redemption, to create something in those who listen which other wise could never have been created. If we simply preach the effects of redemption in the human life instead of the revealed, divine truth regarding Jesus Himself, the result is not new birth in those who listen. The result is a refined religious life style, and the Spirit of God cannot witness to it because such preaching is in a realm other than His. We must make sure that we are living in such harmony with God that as we proclaim His truth He can create in others those things which He alone can do.
original_verse_text: Now I rejoice in what was suffered for you, and I fill up in my flesh what is still lacking in regard to Christ's afflictions, for the sake of His body, which is the church.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, recognizing that we are called to be sacred "go-betweens" - vessels through which Your creating life and redeeming power can flow. May our words and our lives be so closely identified with Your Son, Jesus Christ, that His presence and truth are made manifest in all we do. Empower us, Lord, to proclaim the historical facts of Your redemption, that You may use these sacred words to bring about new birth in those who hear. May our lives be in harmony with Your Spirit, that You may work mightily through us. We surrender ourselves to You, Lord. Amen.
reflection: A Christian worker has to be a sacred "go-between." He/she must be so closely identified with his Lord and the reality of His redemption that Christ can continually bring His creating life through Him. Now I'm not referring to the strength of one individual's personality being superimposed on another, but the real presence of Christ coming through every aspect of the worker's life. When we preach the historical facts of the life and death of our Lord as they are conveyed in the New T. , our words are made sacred. God uses these words, on the basis of His redemption, to create something in those who listen which other wise could never have been created. If we simply preach the effects of redemption in the human life instead of the revealed, divine truth regarding Jesus Himself, the result is not new birth in those who listen. The result is a refined religious life style, and the Spirit of God cannot witness to it because such preaching is in a realm other than His. We must make sure that we are living in such harmony with God that as we proclaim His truth He can create in others those things which He alone can do.
subject: Proclaim Christ's Redeeming Presence
verse_text: Now I rejoice in what was suffered for you, and I fill up in my flesh what is still lacking in regard to Christ's afflictions, for the sake of His body, which is the church.

original_content:
11/10/2010~~~food for thought~~~LET US COME BOLDLY WITH CONFIDENCE

Bible Verse for Today:
16 Let us then approach God's throne of grace with confidence, 
so that we may receive mercy and find grace to help us in our time of need. 

Our Lesson for Today:
The Question is: "What is our approach to the throne of grace?"
The only way is by "prayer". How? Boldly and with confidence.

Some Christians approach God meekly with heads hung low, afraid 
to ask Him to meet their needs.

Others pray flippantly giving little thought to what they say.

What one must do is come with reverence because He is your King.
But also come with bold assurance because He is your Friend and Counselor.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, A pray that Your Spirit will teach me to pray
with boldness and assurance. Amen.


Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one can come to the 
Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: The Question is: "What is our approach to the throne of grace?" The only way is by "prayer". How? Boldly and with confidence. Some Christians approach God meekly with heads hung low, afraid to ask Him to meet their needs. Others pray flippantly giving little thought to what they say. What one must do is come with reverence because He is your King. But also come with bold assurance because He is your Friend and Counselor.
original_verse_text: 16 Let us then approach God's throne of grace with confidence, so that we may receive mercy and find grace to help us in our time of need.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before Your throne of grace with reverence and confidence, knowing that through the sacrifice of Your Son, we have gained access to Your presence. Lord, we approach You boldly, not with timidity or flippancy, but with the assurance that You are our King and our Friend, ever ready to hear our cries and meet our needs. Guide us as we draw near to You in prayer, that we may worship You with sincere hearts and find the grace and strength we need for each day. Amen.
reflection: The question is: "What is our approach to the throne of grace?" The only way is by "prayer." How? Boldly and with confidence. Some Christians approach God meekly with heads hung low, afraid to ask Him to meet their needs. Others pray flippantly, giving little thought to what they say. What one must do is come with reverence because He is your King. But also come with bold assurance because He is your Friend and Counselor.
subject: Approach the Throne Boldly
verse_text: 16 Let us then approach God's throne of grace with confidence, so that we may receive mercy and find grace to help us in our time of need.

original_content:
11/21/2010~~~food for thought~~~GIVING THANKS FOR ANSWERED PRAYER

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Give thanks in all circumstances (things) (Why ?)
For this is the will of God for you in Christ Jesus.(I Thess. 5:18)

Our Lesson for Today:
Our joys and our prayers should not fluctuate with our circumstances...

As you know ~ in the last few days I have went through some 
circumstance that can make one wonder ~ what next!

But we need to remember that Paul never suggested that we are to 
give thanks for all that happens to us, but in all things.

So I am taking this opportunity to offer my thanks to all who said a little
prayer for my quick recovery, for in five days, even though having a 
triple by-pass I was able to walk out of the hospital...

Oh my steps were not as quick as before, but I feel your prayers are 
still working because I feel my strength returning more and more
every day...

But let us not forget to give thanks to the One who answers our prayers.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I thank You for answered prayer ~
I ask Your blessings upon all who use this
gift, not only for their own profit but who
use it to intercede in the needs of others...Amen

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: Our joys and our prayers should not fluctuate with our circumstances. As you know ~ in the last few days I have went through some circumstance that can make one wonder ~ what next! But we need to remember that Paul never suggested that we are to give thanks for all that happens to us, but in all things. So I am taking this opportunity to offer my thanks to all who said a little prayer for my quick recovery, for in five days, even though having a triple bypass I was able to walk out of the hospital. Oh my steps were not as quick as before, but I feel your prayers are still working because I feel my strength returning more and more every day. But let us not forget to give thanks to the One who answers our prayers.
original_verse_text: Give thanks in all circumstances (things) (Why ?) For this is the will of God for you in Christ Jesus.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that in all things, You work for the good of those who love You (Romans 8:28). Even in the midst of trials and circumstances that may cause us to wonder, we choose to give thanks, for Your steadfast love endures forever (1 Thessalonians 5:18). We thank You for hearing and answering the prayers of Your people, and for the strength and healing You have graciously provided. May our lives be a continual offering of praise and thanksgiving to You, our Almighty God. Amen.
reflection: Our joys and our prayers should not fluctuate with our circumstances. As you know ~ in the last few days I have went through some circumstance that can make one wonder ~ what next! But we need to remember that Paul never suggested that we are to give thanks for all that happens to us, but in all things. So I am taking this opportunity to offer my thanks to all who said a little prayer for my quick recovery, for in five days, even though having a triple bypass I was able to walk out of the hospital. Oh my steps were not as quick as before, but I feel your prayers are still working because I feel my strength returning more and more every day. But let us not forget to give thanks to the One who answers our prayers.
subject: Steadfast Gratitude in All Things
verse_text: Give thanks in all circumstances (things) (Why ?) For this is the will of God for you in Christ Jesus.

original_content:
11/23/2010~~~food for thought~~~FREEDOM FOUND

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"So if the Son sets you free, you will be free indeed." (Jn. 8:36)

Our Lesson for Today:
Sin ~ Sin ~ Sin. There is no end to the ways it tries to enslave us,
control us, dominate us, and attempts to dictate our actions.

But Jesus can free you from this slavery that keeps you from becoming
the person God created you to be. If sin is restraining, mastering, or
enslaving you, Jesus can break its power over you.

Jesus said, "Come to Me, all of you who are weary and carry heavy
burdens, and I will give you rest." (Mt. 11:28)

YES SIN CAN BECOME A BURDEN.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I struggle daily with the burden of sin,
so I pray for forgiveness so that I may be set free.Amen. 

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: Sin ~ Sin ~ Sin. There is no end to the ways it tries to enslave us, control us, dominate us, and attempts to dictate our actions. But Jesus can free you from this slavery that keeps you from becoming the person God created you to be. If sin is restraining, mastering, or enslaving you, Jesus can break its power over you. Jesus said, "Come to Me, all of you who are weary and carry heavy burdens, and I will give you rest. " (Matthew 11:28) YES SIN CAN BECOME A BURDEN.
original_verse_text: "So if the Son sets you free, you will be free indeed. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You, weary from the burden of sin that seeks to enslave us. We thank You that through Your Son, Jesus, we can be set free from the power of sin that seeks to control and dominate us. Lord, help us to walk in the freedom that You have purchased for us, that we may become the people You have created us to be. May we find rest and peace in Your presence, and may our lives be a testament to Your redeeming love. Amen.
reflection: Sin, sin, sin. There is no end to the ways it tries to enslave us, control us, dominate us, and attempts to dictate our actions. But Jesus can free you from this slavery that keeps you from becoming the person God created you to be. If sin is restraining, mastering, or enslaving you, Jesus can break its power over you. Jesus said, "Come to Me, all of you who are weary and carry heavy burdens, and I will give you rest." (Matthew 11:28) Yes, sin can become a burden.
subject: Overcome Sin's Enslaving Power
verse_text: "So if the Son sets you free, you will be free indeed. "

original_content:
11/24/1010~~~food for thought~~~GRATITUDE OR INGRATITUDE

Our Bible Verse for Today:
I lift up my eyes to the hills ~ where does my help come from?
My help comes from the Lord, the maker of heaven and earth.(Ps. 121:1, 2)

Our Lesson for Today:
Going to God's house can be a chore or a delight. For the psalmist, 
it was a delight. As a pilgrim attending one of the three great religious
festivals, he rejoiced to worship with God's people in God's house...

It is very easy for us to find worship a chore IF we have unconfused
sin or if our love for God has cooled. ~But if we are close to God
and enjoy His presence, we will be eager to worship and praise Him.

Our attitude toward God will determine our view of worship.
Let us once again approach Him with an attitude of gratitude! ! !

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to always seek You with an attitude of 
thanksgiving, for what you have done for me.Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: Going to God's house can be a chore or a delight. For the psalmist, it was a delight. As a pilgrim attending one of the three great religious festivals, he rejoiced to worship with God's people in God's house. It is very easy for us to find worship a chore IF we have unconfused sin or if our love for God has cooled. ~But if we are close to God and enjoy His presence, we will be eager to worship and praise Him. Our attitude toward God will determine our view of worship. Let us once again approach Him with an attitude of gratitude! ! !
original_verse_text: I lift up my eyes to the hills ~ where does my help come from? My help comes from the Lord, the maker of heaven and earth.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, longing to dwell in Your presence and worship You in Your holy temple. As the psalmist rejoiced to gather with Your people, may our love for You and delight in Your house be renewed. Cleanse us from any unconfessed sin, and rekindle the flame of our devotion, that we may eagerly seek Your face and find joy in praising Your name. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Going to God's house can be a chore or a delight. For the psalmist, it was a delight. As a pilgrim attending one of the three great religious festivals, he rejoiced to worship with God's people in God's house. It is very easy for us to find worship a chore if we have unconfessed sin or if our love for God has cooled. But if we are close to God and enjoy His presence, we will be eager to worship and praise Him. Our attitude toward God will determine our view of worship. Let us once again approach Him with an attitude of gratitude!
subject: Delight in God's House
verse_text: I lift up my eyes to the hills ~ where does my help come from? My help comes from the Lord, the maker of heaven and earth.

original_content:
11/25/2010~~~food for thought~~~HAPPY THANKSGIVING

Our Bible Verse for Today:
We ought to always thank God (II Thess. 1:3a)
Give thanks in all circumstance (I Thess. 5:18a)

Our Lesson for Today:
Yes we have much to be thankful for even during trials because
even then God is trying to teach us something.

Yes even when we are living for Christ, we will experience troubles, because 
we are trying to be God's people in a perverse world. Some people say that 
troubles are the result of sin or the lack faith. But Paul teaches that they may
be a part of God's plan for believers...

Our troubles can help us look upward and forward instead of inward (Mk. 13:35, 36;
Phil. 3:13, 14). They can build strong character (Ro. 5:3, 4). And they can
provide opportunities to comfort other who are also struggling (II Cor 1:3-5).
Our troubles may be an indication that we are taking a stand for Christ.

We occasionally hear of churches going though one struggle after another.
Some years ago an older pastor told me that if you were having trouble it
could be a sign that Satan was trying to discourage you so He could win you
back for himself. He also added that if things were going smoothly it could
be a sign that Satan was happy at were you are at. 

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I thank You that no matter what I am going
through I am assured that You are always near, knowing 
my needs. Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father accept through Me. (Jn. 14:6)




the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: Yes we have much to be thankful for even during trials because even then God is trying to teach us something. Yes even when we are living for Christ, we will experience troubles, because we are trying to be God's people in a perverse world. Some people say that troubles are the result of sin or the lack faith. But Paul teaches that they may be a part of God's plan for believers. Our troubles can help us look upward and forward instead of inward (Mark 13:35, 36; Philippians 3:13, 14). They can build strong character (Romans 5:3, 4). And they can provide opportunities to comfort other who are also struggling (II Corinthians 1:3-5). Our troubles may be an indication that we are taking a stand for Christ. We occasionally hear of churches going though one struggle after another. Some years ago an older pastor told me that if you were having trouble it could be a sign that Satan was trying to discourage you so He could win you back for himself. He also added that if things were going smoothly it could be a sign that Satan was happy at were you are at.
original_verse_text: We ought always to thank God for you, brothers and sisters, and rightly so, because your faith is growing more and more, and the love all of you have for one another is increasing.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, even in the midst of trials and troubles. We know that You are using these experiences to shape us, to build our character, and to draw us closer to You. Help us to see Your hand at work, to look upward and forward, and to find opportunities to comfort others who are also struggling. May our troubles be a testament to our commitment to live for You in this perverse world. We trust in Your plan and give thanks for Your steadfast love. Amen.
reflection: Yes we have much to be thankful for even during trials because even then God is trying to teach us something. Yes even when we are living for Christ, we will experience troubles, because we are trying to be God's people in a perverse world. Some people say that troubles are the result of sin or the lack faith. But Paul teaches that they may be a part of God's plan for believers. Our troubles can help us look upward and forward instead of inward (Mark 13:35, 36; Philippians 3:13, 14). They can build strong character (Romans 5:3, 4). And they can provide opportunities to comfort other who are also struggling (II Corinthians 1:3-5). Our troubles may be an indication that we are taking a stand for Christ. We occasionally hear of churches going though one struggle after another. Some years ago an older pastor told me that if you were having trouble it could be a sign that Satan was trying to discourage you so He could win you back for himself. He also added that if things were going smoothly it could be a sign that Satan was happy at were you are at.
subject: Trials Teach Us Valuable Lessons
verse_text: We ought always to thank God for you, brothers and sisters, and rightly so, because your faith is growing more and more, and the love all of you have for one another is increasing.

original_content:
11/26/2010~~~food for thought~~~THE FOCAL POINT OF OUR FAITH

Our Bible Verse for Today:
As for me, God forbid that I should boast about anything 
except the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ...(Gal 6:14)

Our Lesson for Today:
The world is full of enticements. Every day we are confronted with subtle 
cultural pressures. And it certainly does not help if we are addicted to the TV.

The only way to escape these destructive influences is to ask God to
help crucify our interests in them, just as Paul did. Just how much do the
interests of this world matter to you? ? ?

For more on this concept read Gal. 2:20; and 5:24 (time well spent)

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I pray that You would help me escape
the influences of this world, so that I would not have
anything to boast in but the cross of Jesus Christ. Amen. 
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: The world is full of enticements. Every day we are confronted with subtle cultural pressures. And it certainly does not help if we are addicted to the TV. The only way to escape these destructive influences is to ask God to help crucify our interests in them, just as Paul did. Just how much do the interests of this world matter to you? ? ? For more on this concept read Galatians 2:20; and 5:24 (time well spent)
original_verse_text: As for me, God forbid that I should boast about anything except the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we confess that the allures of this world often captivate our hearts and minds, drawing us away from the eternal treasures of Your kingdom. Help us, by the power of Your Spirit, to set our minds on things above, not on earthly things. May we be crucified to the world, and may Christ live in us, that we may live for Your glory alone. Empower us to fix our eyes on the cross, where our Savior died to set us free from the bondage of sin and death. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: The world is full of enticements. Every day we are confronted with subtle cultural pressures. And it certainly does not help if we are addicted to the TV. The only way to escape these destructive influences is to ask God to help crucify our interests in them, just as Paul did. Just how much do the interests of this world matter to you? For more on this concept, read Galatians 2:20 and 5:24 (time well spent).
subject: Crucify Worldly Interests; Seek God
verse_text: As for me, God forbid that I should boast about anything except the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ.

original_content:
11/27/2010~~~food for thought~~~LIVING BY THE SPIRIT

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Live by the Spirit, and you will not gratify the desires of 
the sinful nature.(Gal. 5:16)

Our Lesson for Today:
When we are not motivated by love, we become critical of others.
We stop looking for the best in them and see only their faults. the 
result is that the unity of believers is broken.

Here is a couple of personal question, "Have you talked about others 
behind their back?" ~ "Have you focused on other's short-coming
instead of their strengths?"

Remind yourself of Jesus' command to love others as you love yourself 
(Mt. 22:39). When you feel critical of someone, make a list of that person's
positive qualities. If there are problems that need to be addressed, it is
better to confront in love than in gossip.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, Help me to be less critical of others 
and more loving, help me to see their positive
qualities. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: When we are not motivated by love, we become critical of others. We stop looking for the best in them and see only their faults. the result is that the unity of believers is broken. Here is a couple of personal question, "Have you talked about others behind their back?" ~ "Have you focused on other's shortcoming instead of their strengths?" Remind yourself of Jesus' command to love others as you love yourself (Matthew 22:39). When you feel critical of someone, make a list of that person's positive qualities. If there are problems that need to be addressed, it is better to confront in love than in gossip.
original_verse_text: Live by the Spirit, and you will not gratify the desires of the sinful nature.
prayer: Heavenly Father, forgive us when we have been critical of others and focused on their faults instead of their strengths. Help us to love one another as You have loved us, with genuine affection and honor. May our unity as believers reflect the love of Christ, that the world may see Your goodness. Guide us to confront problems in love, not gossip. In Your name we pray, Amen.
reflection: When we are not motivated by love, we become critical of others. We stop looking for the best in them and see only their faults. the result is that the unity of believers is broken. Here is a couple of personal question, "Have you talked about others behind their back?" ~ "Have you focused on other's shortcoming instead of their strengths?" Remind yourself of Jesus' command to love others as you love yourself (Matthew 22:39). When you feel critical of someone, make a list of that person's positive qualities. If there are problems that need to be addressed, it is better to confront in love than in gossip.
subject: Overcome Criticism with Love
verse_text: Live by the Spirit, and you will not gratify the desires of the sinful nature.

original_content:
11/28/2010~~~food for thought~~~ALLOWING CHRIST TO RULE

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Let the message of Christ dwell (rule) among you richly as you teach 
and admonish one another with all wisdom through psalms, hymns, 
and songs from the Spirit, singing to God with gratitude in your hearts.
(Col. 3:16) 

Our Lesson for Today:
Christians should live in peace. ~ However to live in peace does not mean
that suddenly all differences of opinion are eliminated, but it does require that 
loving Christians work together despite their differences.

Such love is not a feeling but a decision to meet others' needs (see I Cor. 13).
To live in love leads to peace between individuals and among the members of 
the body of believers.

Do problems in your relationship with other Christians cause open conflicts or 
mutual silence? ~ Consider what you can do to heal those relationships with love.

Whatever you do or say, let it be as a representative of the Lord Jesus. Let it 
bring honor to Christ in every aspect and activity of daily living.

Remember as a Christian, you represent Christ at all times, wherever you go
or whatever you say. What impression do people have of Christ when they 
see or talk with you? What changes would you make in your life in order to
honor Chat? ? ?

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, forgive me for the areas in my life
that are unpleasing to You, and help me to correct
those problems. Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: Christians should live in peace. ~ However to live in peace does not mean that suddenly all differences of opinion are eliminated, but it does require that loving Christians work together despite their differences. Such love is not a feeling but a decision to meet others' needs (see I Corinthians 13). To live in love leads to peace between individuals and among the members of the body of believers. Do problems in your relationship with other Christians cause open conflicts or mutual silence? ~ Consider what you can do to heal those relationships with love. Whatever you do or say, let it be as a representative of the Lord Jesus. Let it bring honor to Christ in every aspect and activity of daily living. Remember as a Christian, you represent Christ at all times, wherever you go or whatever you say. What impression do people have of Christ when they see or talk with you? What changes would you make in your life in order to honor Chat? ? ?
original_verse_text: Let the message of Christ dwell (rule) among you richly as you teach and admonish one another with all wisdom through psalms, hymns, and songs from the Spirit, singing to God with gratitude in your hearts.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the call to live in peace with one another, even amidst our differences. Help us to put aside our selfish desires and instead seek to love and serve our fellow believers with the same sacrificial love that You have shown us in Christ. May our words and actions always bring honor and glory to Your name, representing the Lord Jesus faithfully in all we do. Give us the wisdom and discernment to heal any broken relationships, that we may dwell together in unity. In Jesus' name, Amen.

Such love is not a feeling but a decision to meet others' needs (see I Corinthians 13). To live in love leads to peace between individuals and among the members of the body of believers. Do problems in your relationship with other Christians cause open conflicts or mutual silence? ~ Consider what you can do to heal those relationships with love. Whatever you do or say, let it be as a representative of the Lord Jesus. Let it bring honor to Christ in every aspect and activity of daily living. Remember as a Christian, you represent Christ at all times, wherever you go or whatever you say. What impression do people have of Christ when they see or talk with you? What changes would you make in your life in order to honor Chat? ? ?

original_content:
11/29/2010~~~food for thought~~~LET THE WORD OF GOD BE KNOWN

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Give praise to the LORD, proclaim his name; make known 
among the nations what He has done." - 1 Chronicles 16:8 

Our Lesson for Today:
I think we need to look at a bit of O. T. history, which will help us 
to appreciate this verse more.

We need to remember that God chose Israel to be a blessing to the whole
world (Gen. 12:1-3). This blessing found its fulfillment in Jesus a descendent
of Abraham and David (Gal. 3:8, 9) ~ WHO became the Messiah for all people,
Jews and non-Jews.

We also need to remember that when the Israelites first entered the Promise Land,
they were ordered to clear out several wicked nations, and so we read in the O. T. 
of many wars. Now in this we should never conclude that was Israel's first duty.

After subduing the evil people Israel was to become a light to the surrounding nations.
Sadly, Israel's own sin and spiritual blindness perverted them from reaching out to
the rest of the world with God's love.

So Jesus came to do what the nation of Israel failed to do, so let us "give thanks to the 
Lord and proclaim His greatness."

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, we know that you have called every believer
to proclaim Your name to all people. Forgive us Lord
for falling short of upholding this call. Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John:
14:6
original_reflection_text: I think we need to look at a bit of O. T. history, which will help us to appreciate this verse more. We need to remember that God chose Israel to be a blessing to the whole world (Genesis 12:1-3). This blessing found its fulfillment in Jesus a descendant of Abraham and David (Galatians 3:8, 9) ~ WHO became the Messiah for all people, Jews and non-Jews. We also need to remember that when the Israelites first entered the Promise Land, they were ordered to clear out several wicked nations, and so we read in the O. T. of many wars. Now in this we should never conclude that was Israel's first duty. After subduing the evil people Israel was to become a light to the surrounding nations. Sadly, Israel's own sin and spiritual blindness perverted them from reaching out to the rest of the world with God's love. So Jesus came to do what the nation of Israel failed to do, so let us "give thanks to the Lord and proclaim His greatness. "

prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks to You and proclaim Your greatness. May Your face shine upon us, that Your way may be known on earth, Your salvation among all nations (Psalm 67:1-2). Help us to be a light to the world, that all people may come to know the blessing of Your Son, the Messiah for all. We pray that Your love and salvation would reach the ends of the earth, just as You intended for Your chosen people. Amen.
reflection: I think we need to look at a bit of O. T. history, which will help us to appreciate this verse more. We need to remember that God chose Israel to be a blessing to the whole world (Genesis 12:1-3). This blessing found its fulfillment in Jesus a descendant of Abraham and David (Galatians 3:8, 9) ~ WHO became the Messiah for all people, Jews and non-Jews. We also need to remember that when the Israelites first entered the Promise Land, they were ordered to clear out several wicked nations, and so we read in the O. T. of many wars. Now in this we should never conclude that was Israel's first duty. After subduing the evil people Israel was to become a light to the surrounding nations. Sadly, Israel's own sin and spiritual blindness perverted them from reaching out to the rest of the world with God's love. So Jesus came to do what the nation of Israel failed to do, so let us "give thanks to the Lord and proclaim His greatness. "

original_content:
11/30/2010~~~food for thought~~~AN ETERNAL WELL

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good. His love endures forever. 
Give thanks to the God of heaven. His love endures forever." - Psalm 136:1,26 

Our Lesson for Today:
If you will notice, repeated throughout this Psalm is the phrase, 
"His love endures forever." 

This psalm may have been a responsive reading, with the congregation saying
these words in unison after each sentence. The repetition made this important 
lesson sink in.

God's love includes aspects of love, kindness, mercy, and faithfulness. We 
never have to worry that God will run out of love because it flows from a well 
that will never run dry.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I thank You for Your endless love, kindness, mercy,
and faithfulness.Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: If you will notice, repeated throughout this Psalm is the phrase, "His love endures forever." This psalm may have been a responsive reading, with the congregation saying these words in unison after each sentence. The repetition made this important lesson sink in. God's love includes aspects of love, kindness, mercy, and faithfulness. We never have to worry that God will run out of love because it flows from a well that will never run dry.
original_verse_text: "Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good. His love endures forever. Give thanks to the God of heaven. His love endures forever."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for Your unfailing love that endures forever. Your love for us is steadfast and true, not dependent on our performance or merit, but flowing freely from Your gracious heart. We are humbled by the depth of Your affection, which You have demonstrated through the sacrifice of Your Son. May we rest securely in the knowledge that nothing can separate us from Your eternal love. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: If you will notice, repeated throughout this Psalm is the phrase, "His love endures forever." This psalm may have been a responsive reading, with the congregation saying these words in unison after each sentence. The repetition made this important lesson sink in. God's love includes aspects of love, kindness, mercy, and faithfulness. We never have to worry that God will run out of love because it flows from a well that will never run dry.
subject: Enduring Love of God
verse_text: "Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good. His love endures forever. Give thanks to the God of heaven. His love endures forever."

original_content:
12/01/2010~~~food for thought~~~MORE GODLY LIFE

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"But the day of the Lord will come like a thief. The heavens will 
disappear with a roar; the elements will be destroyed by fire, 
and the earth and everything done in it will be laid bare. 
Since everything will be destroyed in this way, what kind of people 
ought you to be? You ought to live holy and godly lives" - 2 Peter 3:10-11 

Our Lesson for Today:
I believe that we all know that the "Day of the Lord", is the day of God's
judgement on the earth. Here it is used in reference to Christ's return.

Christ's second coming will be sudden and terrible for those who do not 
believe in Him. But if we are morally clean and spiritually alert, it won't come 
as a surprise.

For other prophetic pictures of the day of the Lord, see Isa. 34:4; Joel 3:15, 16
Mt. 24; Mk. 13; Rev. 6:12-17. Realizing that the earth is going to be burned up, 
we should put our confidence in what is lasting and eternal and not be bound to 
earth and its treasures or pursuits.

Do you spend more of your time piling up possessions or striving to develop 
Christlike character?

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord my prayer is that I would develop a Christlike character.
Help me by your Holy Spirit that I might grow in this character each day ...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: I believe that we all know that the "Day of the Lord", is the day of God's judgment on the earth. Here it is used in reference to Christ's return. Christ's second coming will be sudden and terrible for those who do not believe in Him. But if we are morally clean and spiritually alert, it won't come as a surprise. For other prophetic pictures of the day of the Lord, see Isaiah 34:4; Joel 3:15, 16 Matthew 24; Mark 13; Revelation 6:12-17. Realizing that the earth is going to be burned up, we should put our confidence in what is lasting and eternal and not be bound to earth and its treasures or pursuits. Do you spend more of your time piling up possessions or striving to develop Christlike character?
original_verse_text: "But the day of the Lord will come like a thief. The heavens will disappear with a roar; the elements will be destroyed by fire, and the earth and everything done in it will be laid bare. Since everything will be destroyed in this way, what kind of people ought you to be? You ought to live holy and godly lives"
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of the day when the heavens will pass away and the earth will be burned up. Help us to live in light of Your coming judgment, not clinging to the fleeting treasures of this world, but instead pursuing the eternal kingdom that cannot be shaken. May we be found faithful, with hearts that are morally clean and spirits that are spiritually alert, ready to welcome Your Son when He returns. We put our trust in You, the consuming fire, and the unshakable kingdom You have promised. Amen.

subject: Prepare for Christ's Return
